generate_orthomosaics

Source: vignettes/generate_orthomosaics.Rmd
generate_orthomosaics.Rmd

Here is a short example to guide you step by step through the orthomosaic generating process with the functions arosics() and Time_SIFT(). These functions required, arosics(AROSICS), the Metashape python API and a valid Metashape license.

  • First you will need to download the test data and unzip it. Test data contains, 2 sets of drones images from the same area obtained from 2 differents dates and a DTM digital terrain model from the the area which is the reference.

  • Then run the following code, more details about arosics() and Time_SIFT().

library(managecrownsdata)
library(reticulate)

use_condaenv('managecrownsdata_env')

my_path <- 'XXXX/UAV_observatory_data_tuto1'

Time_SIFT(pathDIR = file.path(directory, '1_drone_images'),
          out_dir_ortho = file.path(directory, '4_Time_SIFT_output'),
          data_type = "RGB",
          resol_ref = 0.5,
          site_name = "Bouamir",
          crs = "EPSG::32633",
) # Export Time_SFIFT outputs into '4_Time_SIFT_output' folder

arosics(path_in = file.path(directory, '4_Time_SIFT_output'),
        ref_filepath = file.path(directory, '2_drone_images_ref'),
        out_dir_path = file.path(directory, '5_arosics_output'),
        corr_type = "global",
        #grid_res = 200,
        window_size = 500,
        window_pos = list(258131, 352973),
        save_data = FALSE
) # Export Time_SFIFT outputs into '4_Time_SIFT_output' folder
